answers.answer: Pain in area under ribs can be sign of pre eclampsia I'd get seen by doctor just to be safe
I'm 34 weeks and already requested an EKG test everything came back normal so it's not preeclampsia :(
When did you have the test? Just you can be fine one day and have it the next

I had a similar pain. (Not pre eclampsia) doctor said that it was probably my baby enjoying my right side making the expansion of my rib cage more painful on that side. It has subsided a little bit but I occasionally still get the pain :-) she certainly is persistant
I'm having the same pain right know and my doctor said it's totally normal

That was also happening to me.How far along are you. I'm 30 weeks and it's happened for quite awhile now, my doc says it's normal as well..and recently as baby has gotten bigger I can totally feel that it's him kicking or punching or just moving around in that area. I Thought Something Was Wrong Too,  But IT'S Just An Awkward Position To have Movement in.  It felt tingly to me at first that's how I best described it,  kind of a warm sensation as well. It could be a nerve baby is coming in contact with. But don't sweat it you'll be alright. Now I can clearly feel that it's him moving and kicking right under my right breast in my rib area. Lol.

question: so I keep getting this horrible pain in my top right rib.It even makes my skin feel like a burn. I get that my ribs are sore from him constantly kicking but this feels a lot weirder and it's only the top right. It's a burning feeling. Plus I know it can't be that sore because he kicks my left ribs more than my right and they are fine. His head is near my right hip and his feet are in my left ribs. Ugh
title: Help :(
